---
description: A universal Link component.
---

import { Link } from './link';

A universal Link component that provides compatibility across React routing systems.

## Component usage

Install the component:

```
bit install @bitdesign/sparks.navigation.link
```

Use the Link:

```js
<Link href="http://google.com">Google</Link>
```

Check out the API reference below to learn more on the Link API.

## React Router

By default, the Link uses native `a` tags. To start with React Router, use the Navigation Provider.

```js
<NavigationProvider>
  <Link>Product</Link>
  <Link>Docs</Link>
</NavigationProvider>
```

Keep in mind to render the Navigation Provider in the context of React Router' `Router` context.

## Custom navigation providers

In case you are looking to use the Link in other routing systems than React Router, implenent a Navigation Adapter. To use your own Navigation Adapter implement [NavigationAdapter](/) interface, and use the adapter prop:

```tsx
import { NavigationAdapter } from '@bitdesign/sparks.navigation.link';

const myAdapter: NavigationAdapter = {
  Link: ({ href }) => <a href={href} />
};

export function MyPage() {
  return (
    <NavigationProvider adapter={myAdapter}>
      <Link>Product</Link>
      <Link>Docs</Link>
    </NavigationProvider>
  );
}
```
